intro: Galianthe macedoi, commonly known as the Macedonian galianthe, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, oval fruits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
